alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 8:24PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Dale. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 824 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 4 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elba, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, New Brockton, Ariton, Lee, Mixons Crossroads, Tabernacle, Clintonville, Woodland Grove Church, Eanon, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Victoria, Richburg, Arcus, Camp Humming Hills, Lowry Mill, Java and Shell Army Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
